h2.font:
Welcome to Windham Southeast Supervisory Union and Windham Southeast School District
of Vermont

td.div:
The Windham Southeast Supervisory Union (WSESU) has the administrative responsibility for the school districts in our southeast region; i.e., Windham Southeast School District (including the towns of Brattleboro, Dummerton, Guilford, and Putney) and the Vernon Town School District in Vernon. General oversight of the Supervisory Union falls to the Superintendent who is appointed by the supervisory union board. Each of our two districts has an elected board that establishes policy and presents the annual spending plan to the voters for approval. The Windham Southeast Supervisory Union Board has membership from both district boards, including five directors appointed as voting members.
​

font.font:
WSESU Central Office located at
53 Green Street,
Brattleboro, Vermont 05301

div.span: includes the elementary and middle schools, as well as our high school and career center in the towns of Brattleboro, Dummerston, Guilford, and Putney. Those schools are Academy School in Brattleboro, Oak Grove School in Brattleboro, Green Street School in Brattleboro, Brattleboro Area Middle School, Brattleboro Union High School and the Windham Regional Career Center, Dummerston School, Guilford Central School, and Putney Central School. Early Education Services in Brattleboro is also part of the WSESD.

br.span: ​The Vernon Elementary School is included in the

br.br: ​For more information about each school, click the button below..

div.span: is to provide a safe, inclusive and supportive environment where all students grow academically, socially, and emotionally, and are challenged to reach their potential as local and global community members.

div.div: Windham County is a vibrant community and a great place to live. WSESU works with a number of community organizations that help our students grow and learn. It takes a community to raise a child, therefore we rely on the help of our community partners to assist students and families in many ways. For more information about our community and the services they offer to students and families in the WSESU, click the community link below

Windham Southeast Supervisory Union employs over 800 professionals in a variety of positions from teachers to support staff, paraprofessionals to groundskeepers. We value the work that our teachers and employees do every day, that is why it makes our school district one of the best places to live and work in. For information about working in our district, click the employment link below.

Click on the event listed on the calendar for further details about the event.
Events listed on this calendar are events happening throughout the schools in our district. Contact the school directly if you have any questions.
